channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Still no answers for some after WINZ investigation into wrongly denied payments
item.description: Some people who were wrongly denied the benefit based on redundancy payments, or never applied because of misleading advice, say they still have no answers months after applying to have their cases reviewed.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 20 August
item.description: There were five new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, as the government was urged to launch a pandemic response inquiry - among other developments.

item.title: Canterbury medical community voice their anger at DHB
item.description: The Canterbury medical community's frustration with its health chiefs reached a boiling point today, with a protest, an open letter and two more resignations on the District Health Board's executive team.

item.title: Rydges case investigation looks into masks and lift arrangements
item.description: Investigations into how a maintenance worker contracted Covid-19 in an isolation facility will look into whether the worker and traveller who carried the strain should have used different lifts, and if masks were worn.

item.title: Two arrests after alleged breaches of Auckland's alert level 3 restrictions
item.description: Police have arrested and charged two men with breaching Auckland's level 3 restrictions and another five people have been warned for breaches.

item.title: Covid-19: St Lukes Mall shop employee worked while infectious
item.description: A Westfield St Lukes retail employee with Covid-19 worked at the mall for number of days while infectious.

item.title: Auckland volcanic cones to close unless fireworks banned
item.description: The gates to the 14 Auckland volcanic cones will remain closed during Guy Fawkes unless the government move to ban the public sale of fireworks, the TÅ«puna Maunga Authority says.

item.title: Covid-19: Northland economy hit by Auckland's level 3 restrictions
item.description: Northland is effectively cut off since Auckland's level 3 restrictions were introduced, with travel controls contributing to lay-offs and disrupting supply lines in the country's northern tip.

item.title: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and the world on 20 August
item.description: Five people have been warned and two have been arrested and charged for breaching level 3 restrictions in Auckland. See how the day unvolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Five new cases of Covid-19 in community linked to Auckland cluster
item.description: Director-General of Health Ashley Bloomfield says all new cases relate to the existing Auckland cluster, with one based in Tokoroa.

item.title: Need for Winter Pride greater than ever - Martin King
item.description: As rainbow flags go up around Queenstown in preparation for Winter Pride, festival director and co-owner Martin King is waiting to hear whether he can attend.

item.title: Councillor joins protest against live export of dairy cows
item.description: A small group of activists have held a "vigil" and picketed the offices of Port Taranaki in protest at the live export of dairy cows to China.

item.title: 'Major security operation' planned for Christchurch mosque shooter sentencing, police say
item.description: There will be an increased police presence around Christchurch for the sentencing of the mosque gunman.

item.title: Police officers who fired 35 shots after car chase justified - IPCA
item.description: Police officers who fired 35 shots at a man, hitting him twice after a second car chase in Christchurch last year, were justified in doing so.

item.title: Man accused of stealing government laptop from managed isolation facility
item.description: The 32-year-old allegedly entered the reception area of Crowne Plaza on Albert Street by climbing over a barrier fence on 8 July and was confronted before fleeing.

item.title: Queenstown mayor hopeful of hosting Rugby Championship teams
item.description: The four team competition featuring the All Blacks, Australia, South Africa and Argentina, is due to be held in New Zealand from 7 November to 12 December.

item.title: Expert warns New Plymouth chemical plant needs testing for dioxin contamination
item.description: The land that a controversial chemical plant in New Plymouth is built on should be thoroughly tested for contamination before it is ever used again, according to an expert.

item.title: 'A $27m hole': Tauranga faces huge bill for defective carpark building
item.description: Tauranga ratepayers face a $7m-plus bill to demolish a defect-riddled central city carpark building, but dodged a catastrophic failure.
